text:
Looking for good barista coffee after lunch, I stumbled upon Slow Joe, a chill hipster cafe with a relaxed vibe and interesting, simple branding.

üíß Water is chargeable by the bottle.

Seating is limited, but the barista was friendly and recommended their signature Bandung Latte and Cuppa Joe.

I opted for the Cuppa Joe, which was a unique layered latte. The first sip was a creamy, whipped cream cheese-like foam with cocoa powder, followed by the espresso, and underneath was a milky, slightly sweet base.

Mixing it all together created a smooth latte with a rich espresso finish. While $9 felt a tad pricey, the interesting drinking experience made it feel like good value.

Service by staff was good, though the space is small, accommodating only a few small groups indoors. Overall, a good barista cafe coffee experience worth checking out if you're in the area.

This cozy and aesthetic coffee stop is perfect for a quick yet mindful matcha fix. Its small dine-in area invites you to slow down and savour the moment, just as its name suggests.

One of the things that sets Hey Slow Joe apart is their commitment to quality. They use ceremonial-grade matcha from Japan, ensuring that every sip is smooth, earthy, and packed with authentic flavour. What‚Äôs more, their drinks feature a single giant ice cube, a small but thoughtful touch that keeps the drink chilled without diluting its taste.

I was especially intrigued by their Iced Matcha Yakult ($9.80) - a combination I had never come across before. Swapping out milk for probiotic Yakult turned out to be a genius move. The Yakult‚Äôs natural sweetness and tangy profile blended seamlessly with the bitter and umami-rich matcha, creating a drink that was both creamy and refreshingly light. It‚Äôs a unique twist on the usual matcha latte, and one that I would definitely return for.

To go with my drink, I tried their Matcha Mochi Tart ($9.50), which is handmade exclusively at their space. The tart crust was firm and buttery, holding together a luscious matcha custard that was smooth, silky, and earthy. The stretchy mochi layer added an unexpected but delightful chewiness, making each bite a textural delight. The matcha flavour shone through beautifully without being overpowering, striking the perfect balance between richness and sweetness.

Hey Slow Joe may be a small space, but its menu leaves a big impression. I‚Äôm already looking forward to my next visit to try their Matcha Rose Latte, Strawberry Matcha Latte, and Dirty Matcha Latte.
The flat white was awesome!! Super fragrant :) encountered some payment issue but the staff (girl in braid) (didn't her name) was very patient with me as well, I appreciate it!! Will come back again!
